data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
stage of CDC synchronizer
0x0: 2-stage synchronizer
0x1: 3-stage synchronizer
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
Read after write enable. If there are data hazards between DMA ports, do write first and
then read when this bit enable.
Note: enable this bit will cause extra 1 idle latency.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
Enable this bit to return bus error when ECC error occurs.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
For DMA port itself write and read arbitration.
If write and read access DFI interface at the same time and read has higher priority,
read grant reach "wr_patience+1" times and write will switch to higher priority.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
For DMA port itself write and read arbitration.
If write and read access DFI interface at the same time and write has higher priority,
write grant reach "rd_patience+1" times and read will switch to higher priority.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1BUSCFG
data.Description:
Default priority for Port Arbiter. Higher value has higher priority.
Note: Same value can't be shared between DMA Ports. Must be distinguished.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1PSAR
data.Description:
Each bit-field in PRI_TOKEN represents the "token", which value means the priority scheduler.
Low  Priority: Set the token value in the register to 0.
High Priority: Set the token value in the register to 1.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: OC1DPWC
data.Description:
DRAM write command profiling.
Increment by one if a single DRAM burst write is performed by corresponding DMA port.
Must enable prof_en to trigger.
Note: Read this register when DRAM controller is idle or prof_en is disabled.

data.NAME: OC1DPRC
data.Description:
DRAM read command profiling.
Increment by one if a single DRAM burst read is performed by corresponding DMA port
Must enable prof_en to trigger.
Note: Read this register when DRAM controller is idle or prof_en is disabled.

data.NAME: OC1DPRMWC
data.Description:
DRAM Read-Modify-Write(RMW) command profiling.
Increment by one if a single RMW is performed by corresponding DMA port.
This register only exist when HW_RMW_EN == 1
Must enable prof_en to trigger.
Note: Read this register when DRAM controller is idle or prof_en is disabled.

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
DFI clock ratio
0x0: 2:1 mode
0x1: 1:1 mode
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
DRAM command profiling enable
0x0: disable
0x1: enable
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
Set 1'b1 to enable Port arbiter, otherwise Port Arbiter is disabled.
When Port arbiter is disabled, all of DRAM request is pending until Port arbiter is enable.
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
Read-Modify-Write(RMW) enable
Enable when DRAM controller masked write is not allowed.
All of partial write or unaligned write will perform read first.
Then, write data will be merged with returned read data and write back to DRAM.
Note: Must enable when ECC is on.
0x0: disable
0x1: enable
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
Error-correcting code(ECC) enable.
ECC algorithm base on hamming code(72, 64) for single error correction and double error detection.
RMW must enable too when ECC is on.
All of partial or unaligned write will perform RMW operation.
When performing RMW, the returned read data could cause ECC errors.
If read data came from unwritten location, read data is unknown, which will cause unexpected ECC Error.
To prevent this, such location must be pre-written.
0x0: disable
0x1: enable
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
Normally, uncorrectable error will result in bus response error.
Enable this bit, correctable error also result in bus response error.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
DRAM page size
0x0: 256 Byte
0x1: 512 Byte
0x2:  1K Byte
0x3:  2K Byte
0x4:  4K Byte
0x5   8K Byte
0x6: 16K Byte
0x7: 32K Byte
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFICFG
data.Description:
DRAM bank size
0x0:  2
0x1:  4
0x2:  8
0x3: 16
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
dfi interrupt enable
when dfi error occur, interrupt will trigger and save first error
for detail error information, see DFIERROR register description
0x0 disable
0x1 enable
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
Write 1'b1 to clear interrupt.
HW auto-clear
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
enable this bit when user need to check if there is a data hazards between DMA ports.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
enable this to log first conflict address, otherwise keep updating incoming conflict address
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
port debug select
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIDBG
data.Description:
dfi debug select
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: DFIERROR
data.Description: PCTL error, see PCTL spec CR_ISR/CR_IMR for detail info

data.NAME: DFICADDR
data.Description: The conflict address resulting in Data Hazards

data.NAME: ECCFORCEERROR0
data.Description:
Force data[31:0] error.
set 1 will force corresponding bit inverted
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCFORCEERROR1
data.Description:
Force data[63:32] error.
set 1 will force corresponding bit inverted
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCFORCEERROR2
data.Description:
Force parity error.
set 1 will force corresponding bit inverted
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Enable ECC double error interrupt.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Enable ECC single error interrupt.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Enable to keep first error until ecc_intr_clr is trigger.
Otherwise keep updating incoming error in ECCSTAT register.
Programming Mode: static

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Write 1'b1 force ecc_double_error asserted.
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Write 1'b1 force ecc_single_error asserted.
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Write 1'b1 to clear double error information register.
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: ECCINTR
data.Description:
Write 1'b1 to clear single error information register.
Programming Mode: dynamic

data.NAME: ECCSTAT
data.Description:
Indicate the error bit of ECC lane1 if there is a single-bit error.
Read Syndrome Table for more detail.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSTAT
data.Description:
Indicate the error bit of ECC lane0 if there is a single-bit error.
Read Syndrome Table for more detail.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSTAT
data.Description:
Indicate ECC double error occurred when performing RMW operation.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSTAT
data.Description:
Indicate ECC double-bit error.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSTAT
data.Description:
Indicate ECC single-bit error.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCERRORCNT
data.Description:
ECC double error counter.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCERRORCNT
data.Description:
ECC single error counter.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEDATA0
data.Description:
The read data cause ECC double error.
if both ECC lane has double error, only save ECC lane0.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEDATA1
data.Description:
The read data cause ECC double error.
if both ECC lane has double error, only save ECC lane0.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEDATA2
data.Description:
The read data cause ECC double error.
if both ECC lane has double error, only save ECC lane0.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEADDR0
data.Description:
The number of DRAM bank causes double error.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEADDR0
data.Description:
The number of DRAM row  causes double error.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCDEADDR1
data.Description:
The number of DRAM column causes double error.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_de_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSEBIT0
data.Description:
This register gives an overall indication of which bits are corrected.
The indication includes both ECC lane0 and lane1.
The 71-bit indicates the correction of parity[7] and
n bit indicate n+1 bit of Syndrome Table.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSEBIT1
data.Description:
This register gives an overall indication of which bits are corrected.
The indication includes both ECC lane0 and lane1.
The 71-bit indicates the correction of parity[7] and
n bit indicate n+1 bit of Syndrome Table.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: ECCSEBIT2
data.Description:
This register gives an overall indication of which bits are corrected.
The indication includes both ECC lane0 and lane1.
The 71-bit indicates the correction of parity[7] and
n bit indicate n+1 bit of Syndrome Table.
Clear this register field by writing 1'b1 to ecc_se_intr_clr.

data.NAME: BIST_STATUS
data.Description: bus drf bist start pause status

data.NAME: BIST_STATUS
data.Description: bus drf bist start pause status

data.NAME: BIST_STATUS
data.Description: bus drf bist start pause status

data.NAME: BIST_STATUS
data.Description: bus drf bist start pause status

data.NAME: BIST_FAIL
data.Description: bstc cmd drf sram bist fail

data.NAME: BIST_FAIL
data.Description: bstc msk drf sram bist fail

data.NAME: BIST_FAIL
data.Description: bstc  wd drf sram bist fail

data.NAME: BIST_FAIL
data.Description: bstc  rd drf sram bist fail

data.NAME: BIST_FAIL
data.Description: bstc  rg drf sram bist fail

data.NAME: RAM_RME
data.Description: bstc cmd sram read margin enable

data.NAME: RAM_RME
data.Description: bstc msk sram read margin enable

data.NAME: RAM_RME
data.Description: bstc  wd sram read margin enable

data.NAME: RAM_RME
data.Description: bstc  rd sram read margin enable

data.NAME: RAM_RME
data.Description: bstc  rg sram read margin enable
